title: Have you read 'who will cry when you die' ? How was it? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes ! Who will cry when you die is a self-help book authored by Robin Sharma which I read way back when I was really into the self help genre. You don’t have to be a self-help genre lover to enjoy this book. All you need is a motive to improve yourself and this book is perfect for that. My thoughts on this book: I absolutely love self help books which have bullet points and short descriptions instead of extremely long stories on how someone turned their life around (not that it’s wrong, just not my cup of tea). This book has 101 pointers on how to live your best life.It goes without saying that self help books are not the one-for-all solution to all your life problems however they do give you this motivational high which stays with you until you wake up the next day. It is up to you how you make use of that!You might even come across some point that you might not have given any thought before in your life. That’s what makes this book worth reading.Other books by Robin Sharma worth checking out: The Monk who sold his Ferrari. Happy Reading!

Yes, I have read it in the recent times. It's a small book but with many important qualities to understand. It's a very practical book about how one should live his life properly for which he or she will not be regretful. Despite this, there are some important qualities to learn how successful and effective people live their lives. In the book, the author has given the tips so that we can understand the true sense of life.
